acknowledgments.summary: Siemens reported theses vulnerabilities to CISA.

notes.title: Legal Notice

notes.text: Successful exploitation of these vulnerabilities could cause denial-of-service condition.
notes.title: Risk evaluation

notes.text: CRITICAL INFRASTRUCTURE SECTORS: Chemical, Critical Manufacturing, Energy, Food and Agriculture, Water and Wastewater Systems
notes.title: Critical infrastructure sectors

notes.text: CISA recommends users take defensive measures to minimize the risk of exploitation of these vulnerabilities. Specifically, users should:
notes.title: Recommended Practices

notes.text:
CISA reminds organizations to perform proper impact analysis and risk assessment prior to deploying defensive measures.
CISA also provides a section for control systems security recommended practices on the ICS webpage on cisa.gov/ics. Several recommended practices are available for reading and download, including Improving Industrial Control Systems Cybersecurity with Defense-in-Depth Strategies.
notes.title: Recommended Practices

notes.text:
Additional mitigation guidance and recommended practices are publicly available on the e ICS webpage on cisa.gov/ics in the Technical Information Paper, ICS-TIP-12-146-01B--Targeted Cyber Intrusion Detection and Mitigation Strategies.
Organizations observing any suspected malicious activity should follow their established internal procedures and report their findings to CISA for tracking and correlation against other incidents.
notes.title: Recommended Practices

references.summary: ICS Advisory ICSA-19-253-03 - Web Scraped Version

SIPLUS ET 200SP CP 1543SP-1 ISEC TX RAIL (6AG2543-6WX00-4XE0) - < 2.1

branches.name: SIPLUS ET 200SP CP 1543SP-1 ISEC TX RAIL (6AG2543-6WX00-4XE0)

product.name: RUGGEDCOM RX 1400 VPE Debian Linux - < 9  Linux Image 2019-12-13

cwe.name: Excessive Data Query Operations in a Large Data Table

notes.text: The kernel can be forced to make very expensive calls for every incoming TCP Selective Acknowledgement (SACK) packet which can lead to a denial-of-service condition.CVE-2019-8460 has been assigned to this vulnerability. A CVSS v3 base score of 7.5 has been calculated; the CVSS vector string is (AV:N/AC:L/PR:N/UI:N/S:U/C:N/I:N/A:H).
notes.title: Vulnerability Summary

remediations.details: Siemens recommends users follow the specific workarounds and mitigations below. Siemens has also released fixes for the following products:
Siemens has identified the following specific workarounds and mitigations users can apply to reduce the risk:

As a general security measure, Siemens strongly recommends users protect network access to devices with As a general security measure, Siemens recommends protecting network access to devices with appropriate mechanisms. To operate the devices in a protected IT environment, Siemens recommends configuring the environment according to Siemens’ operational guidelines for industrial security and following recommendations in the product manuals.
Additional information on industrial security by Siemens can be found on the Siemens industrial security webpage.
For more information, please see Siemens Security Advisory SSA-462066

notes.text: The kernel is affected by an integer overflow when handling TCP Selective Acknowledgements, which could allow a remote attacker to cause a denial-of-service condition.CVE-2019-11477 has been assigned to this vulnerability. A CVSS v3 base score of 7.5 has been calculated; the CVSS vector string is (AV:N/AC:L/PR:N/UI:N/S:U/C:N/I:N/A:H).
notes.title: Vulnerability Summary

Additional information on industrial security by Siemens can be found on the Siemens industrial security webpage.
For more information, please see Siemens Security Advisory SSA-462066

notes.text: A remote attacker sending specially crafted TCP Selective Acknowledgment (SACK) sequences may cause a denial-of-service condition.CVE-2019-11478 has been assigned to this vulnerability. A CVSS v3 base score of 5.3 has been calculated; the CVSS vector string is (AV:N/AC:L/PR:N/UI:N/S:U/C:N/I:N/A:L).

notes.text: An attacker may exploit a vulnerability in the TCP retransmission queue implementation kernel when handling TCP Selective Acknowledgements (SACK) to cause a denial-of-service condition.CVE-2019-11479 has been assigned to this vulnerability. A CVSS v3 base score of 5.3 has been calculated; the CVSS vector string is (AV:N/AC:L/PR:N/UI:N/S:U/C:N/I:N/A:L).
notes.title: Vulnerability Summary
